intro: Eutoca phacelioides, commonly known as the mountain flax, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its fibrous roots and compact growth form make it well adapted to harsh mountain climates. Eutoca phacelioides is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
